Previous: kadNext: kam

√kan 'be pleased, enjoy'

present: [4.] kā́yamāna  

perfect: cākana  cākánas etc.  cākanyāt  cākandhi etc.  cakánanta  cākánanta  cākán  caké  cakāná  

aorist: [5.] akāniṣam  kā́niṣas  

derivatives: kanā́  kanaka? E.+  kaniṣṭhá V.B.  kániṭtha B.+  kanī́na V.+  kánīyas V.+  kanyā̀ V.+  -kāti RV.  -kāyyà RV.  

Doubtless the same with the following root, kam. The stem cākán, on account of its accent, rather perfect than intensive.
